adm:managed-object.name: plugin
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis: Plug-ins provide a mechanism for executing custom code at specified points in operation processing and in the course of other events like connection establishment and termination, server startup and shutdown, and LDIF import and export.

adm:property.name: enabled
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether the plug-in is enabled for use.

adm:property.name: java-class
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the fully-qualified name of the Java class that provides the plug-in implementation.

adm:property.name: plugin-type
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the set of plug-in types for the plug-in, which specifies the times at which the plug-in is invoked.

adm:value.name: startup
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Invoked during the Directory Server startup process.

adm:value.name: shutdown
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Invoked during a graceful Directory Server shutdown.

adm:value.name: postconnect
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Invoked whenever a new connection is established to the server.

adm:value.name: postdisconnect
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Invoked whenever an existing connection is terminated (by either the client or the server).

adm:value.name: ldifimport
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Invoked for each entry read during an LDIF import.

adm:value.name: ldifexport
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Invoked for each operation to be written during an LDIF export.

adm:value.name: preparseabandon
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Invoked prior to parsing an abandon request.

adm:property.name: invoke-for-internal-operations
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether the plug-in should be invoked for internal operations.
adm:property.adm:description: Any plug-in that can be invoked for internal operations must ensure that it does not create any new internal operatons that can cause the same plug-in to be re-invoked.
